intro: Biophytum madurense, commonly known as the Madura false pimpernel, is a flowering plant native to parts of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Phyllanthaceae and is characterized by its small, delicate leaves and clusters of yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests and shrublands. It has a compact growth habit with a short, upright stem. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and horticultural studies.
